page.title: 07Redlynch Park.
page.content: The old house at {Redlynch}was built by the Earl of Ilchester (one of whose titles was the Baron of Redlynch), and what is now known as 'The Towers' was the original grand entrance leading to the house. It was built to impress George III, who often visited Redlynch on his way to and from Weymouth. By the early 20th century, a second house was built adjacent to the first, which was falling into a state of disrepair. This unoccupied house was burnt by suffragettes and nothing now remains of it. Redlynch Park was owned by the Countess of Suffolk and Berkshire until the 1960's; she employed over 50 staff. It then became a girls' finishing school and cookery college, until 1981. The House and Stables were sold for conversion into flats, but this project is still incomplete.
